title: Feels like all my losses come with some kind of caveat
body:
It's almost never just losing because one team just played better or capitalized on an opportunity. That's like 1 out of every 10 losses. 

Sometimes my botlane will still be in provisionals and have no history playing ranked, vs. people as high as Gold 3 and sometimes Gold 2. 

Sometimes someone will do a troll pick but I tell myself "high elo smurfs get through this stuff all the time, it's just a part of the game." Something like Leblanc support and full AP Malph jungle. 

Or sometimes someone AFKs for the first few minutes and comes back before we can remake, or continues to DC and we start the game at a pretty high disadvantage. 

And yeah you'll probably look at my match history and be like "Oh you're a Jax player quit complaining." Only reason I play Jax is cause he's strong enough to give a fighting chance in all these scenarios. If I played the champions that I really wanted to play all these game would likely be auto-losses. At least on Jax I can get fed enough to carry said situations. 

end rant. I'm going to go have some ice cream.

replies.body:
I had a jungler who forgot to take smite last night.

Yes, it actually GIVES you smite as soon as you're put in jungle now, but he still somehow managed to not take it.

What's really dumb is that this isn't even that unusual an occurrence. I've been told, if you consistently dominate your lane, you will win enough games to climb no matter what anyone else is doing. I don't know about that, though. It seems like you have to grind through so many games where something totally ridiculous makes the game unwinnable no matter what you do and lose all that LP before you finally get that fair chance to prove your worth and crush your lane.
Yeah no, that seems pretty false. Even if you win lane (especially top), if your bot fucks up too much, your lead doesnt exist.

> [{quoted}](name=Ragnaveil,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E5Rjwz3G,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2019-10-16T00:12:59.133+0000)
>
> Yeah no, that seems pretty false. Even if you win lane (especially top), if your bot fucks up too much, your lead doesnt exist.

I find the opposite true. It doesn’t matter how fed the jinx is. She still dies instantly to the 0/7 renekton. Or the 1/13 Jax. Or the 0/4 irelia.

> [{quoted}](name=The thigh guy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E5Rjwz3G,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2019-10-16T00:27:06.130+0000)
>
> I find the opposite true. It doesn’t matter how fed the jinx is. She still dies instantly to the 0/7 renekton. Or the 1/13 Jax. Or the 0/4 irelia.

Normally I would agree with you, but oh boy did I have a grudge match yesterday. I was getting entirely too fed in the bottom lane, but so too was the enemy Darius in top lane. He was 10/0 when I first encountered him, and it became a slaughterfest of who can do more lasting damage to the other's 4 pawns to push the pieces across the board, and I actually overcame a literal 10/0 out of lane phase Darius. With the right play, a fed ADC *can* work around a fed top laner.

I basically feel the whole "play enough games you'll climb" shit only applies to botlanes and jungles.

I've seen midlaners consistently dominatung their lane, having 20/2/10 KDAs, but they just can't carry the botlane that fed 0/15 by minute 15. They come out of lane having fed 3/5 players on the enemy team.

As a top laner 90% of the time you feel like you have no effect on the game. You got first kill, won lane, took first tower, took herald, roamed mid.

Your botlane will not lane swap, the ADC  is "split pushing" somewhere, the support or jungle is MIA somewhere on the map, existing somehow if not inting but not pushing, taking objectives, clearing or creating vision.

So you are 3v5 trying to capitalize on your lead but you just can't.

Also, if toplane gets camped, they legit, and I mean legit, will be able to do nothing for the rest of the game depending on their pick. So if your jg decides to not match it and go even with even trades in botlane, gl trying to win.

That dude has to be troll, it does literally give you smite if you're jg now xD

And I agree with you completely. Makes you wonder just how many games smurfs have to play to get the point where they understand how to win and play accordingly no matter what's in front of them. I was 1 win away from gold back in June but tilted all the way back down to Silver 3. I've worked my way back up to Silver 1 but the quality of games has taken a nosedive.

If ranked has taught me nothing else... sometimes you just gotta dodge.  It's not worth wasting ~30 minutes of your time if you have a LB support.

Also, maybe you already know this but: If someone has the wrong runes (e.g. {{summoner:6}} {{summoner:11}} Caitlyn ADC), just kindly remind them.  It's often an honest mistake

Im currently logging all my Ranked matches.
Tracking each Roles overall Win% at time of match and the teams average Rank and then average win%
At the end of the match I note who fed and who stomped.

VERY often my end comments will be 22% overall win rate Jungler fed all enemy lanes 
OR
45% Win Rate Support ended 0/14 Enemy bot lane stomped.
OR
57% Win Rate Top stomped 40% win rate laner

From what Im seeing so far.  Riots MMR system does not care who is vs who lane wise. It ONLY Cares about Average win% of the team AND when Que time is long and there is an autofil the difference inn Win% can be as high as 10%.

Also a Difference of 0.5% tilts often to the higher team unless the  Average Rank of the team is different.

Would love to throw all this data into a Neural network and see what comes out.

> Sometimes someone will do a troll pick but I tell myself "high elo smurfs get through this stuff all the time, it's just a part of the game." Something like Leblanc support and full AP Malph jungle. 

In gold? Nothing trolly about that, especially not the latter.

> Only reason I play Jax is cause he's strong enough to give a fighting chance in all these scenarios.

Ever heard the phrase "top lane is an island"? An island based on a coinflip in champ select, in this case.

Funny enough, it's not as big a coinflip as most people claim.  At least not to me at my current level. You can at the very least play evenly into most matchups with decent wave management. I'm not trying live by the "top lane is an island" excuse anymore cause many of the games I've won in the last few days were on me to carry. I see high elo people do it all the time too
